Posts.Content: justme1979 wrote: Hi all! I'm 32 and from Canada. I'm married with 2 kids. 8 and 2, (yes we have a gap!)Breast cancer never crossed my mind, until yesterday. I went to clinic to have my left breast looked at, as there has been an ongoing non-urgent issue with it since breastfeeding my daughter 8 yrs ago. I was never able to breast feed my son from my left breast. My right breast I thought was issue free. Never felt a lump or anything. But my left breast was why I was there, It has always caused a little discomfort, but other than that I dealt with it, I went to see what was causing it (yesterday). She examined my left breast , which was okay, but then she examined my right breast as well, and felt a lump. I thought that was odd. She says "here is a lump." I said   "oh, no I mean I was having issues with the left, not the right,." She says, "no I mean you have one in your right."  So here I am for my left and walk out with issues on my right. I'm optimistic, Just waiting for the ultrasound and mammo. But sure enough I get home and felt for myself, I never imagined lumps. But I'm not overly concerned but I know its still good to get checked. I have known a dozen women my age with BC, so Its always good to be safe. I'll keep yous posted on my appts. Are cancerous lumps always noticable? Nice meeting all of yous! justme1979 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 32 new here, waiting for mammogram&Ultrasound justme1979 angelinac

Posts.Content: May 6, 2011 12:00PM justme1979 wrote: HI SpecialK! Thanks for the information very, helpful. Yes, breast cancer has never really crossed my mind at all. But.. I can almost guarantee that forsure one lump is a cyst.  It definately feels like one, (squishy and filled fluid like) Not to mention that I have also had cysts in my right hip before that were removed. But the other lump feel different- Again, i'm not too concerned about cancer, But I should still be optimistic. Cause it could be, or it won't be. I only have 2 weeks left,sure I'll be more nervouse as it approaches. But its good to be prepared. If you don't mind me asking....were your lumps palpable, or did you think they were cysts?

Posts.Content: May 6, 2011 06:35PM justme1979 wrote: Special K,,(by the way,,I LOVE FLORIDA!!!!) The best orange juice! Thanks so much for the response.We were in clearwater/st.petes 2 yrs ago, then drove to orlando. Love to visit tampa though. You just never know when it comes to breast cancer now these days. I'm so glad you went, but you probably said the smaething I've been saying. I know people always say, that in younger women my age it is more than likely benign. BUT,, I know more younger ladies my age or younger that have had breast cancer, than older ones. (that I have personally know) Cancer doesn't discriminate. So I am glad that you have had everything checked,,and caught... Yes you did make the right decision. Sometimes I feel sick to my stomach now, cause I'm thinking,,"what if".But I bguess it is, what it is.. and hopefully it would be early enough, but i will keep you posted,, mmm, orange juice!!
Posts.Title: 32 new here, waiting for mammogram&Ultrasound justme1979 angelinac

Posts.Content: May 6, 2011 12:50PM justme1979 wrote: Hi Texaslonghorn (love the name!) Thats what I figured. better be safe then sorry. I had 2 close friends my age with breast cancer and at least 9 other acquaintances that have had it too. I know there is many different kinds I think that is why I am being optimistic. I've had a 7 yr history with my left breast. During breastfeeding with oldest daughter (8 now) i kept feeling like a Small pea sized lump that would want to come shooting out from my nipple. (sorry,only way to describe it ) It pinched an burned so bad. I never ever then at that time thought about breast cancer, I just wanted them to make the burning, pea sized thing go away.  So months later they removed a small sac of fluid. But I was breastfeeding at the time anyways. then yrs go by and I became pregnant with my son. I thought maybe I had scar tissue or something form when they removed the "sac of fluid" because my breast became engorged with milk after his birth (like 5 days e-whenever the milk comes in) and my left breast stopped working. It hurt of course, back to hospital. the nurses and emerg, couldn't get any milk out. So I got rx to fix a blocked duct.(so they thought)  No milk ever came out, and We don't know why. I wasn't able to breastfeed my son off it (the left one) that was 2 yrs ago.Smart health care, no u/s or mammo.( I should've asked) Its never really been looked into, so thats why I went for appt last week, as my left breast is burning again-maybe scar tissue. But then last week, she found 2 lumps in my right. Nothing negative with my left besides the past history, milk . Thanks so much for responding and sharing. You just never know, and its always good to get checked.-I liked the lady I seen. Because after she felt the lumps, She said you should get those checked, and set me up. Rather then me having to ask. So that was good! I hear of so many women that actually verbally ask their Doctors for u/s or mammos and they say "nope, we'll just wait, doens't look serious." How can a dr feel it its serious or not!? Do they have special xrated vision or something to see in your breast? So its good when health care providers actually say "lets book you". Thanks again, I'll keep you posted
